isis.stitle: CAB: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - INSTRUMENT PANEL (AFTER DECEMBER 5, 1995)

svcprocinfo.para: Removable instrument panel sections provide for easy access to speedometer, cables, gauges, bulbs, wiring, plumbing, switches, valves, etc. For further information on the instrument panel, refer to GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

svcsubproc.title: Remove

important.para: Always disconnect battery ground before servicing or removing instrument panel cover.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 13for Items in parentheses.

calloutgroup.callout1: 8. PAN HEAD SCREWS, 10-16 x 1/2 (BLACK) AND FLAT WASHER
11. PAN HEAD SCREW, 10-16 x 1/2 (BLACK) AND FLAT WASHER

step1.para: With driver side door open, remove one pan head screw (Item 12) in the left end of the driver side (left), upper instrument panel cover (Item 3).
Remove one pan head screw (Item 12) at the right end of the driver side (left), upper instrument panel cover (Item 3).
Remove driver side (left), upper instrument panel cover (Item 3).

svcsubproc.para: If the vehicle is equipped with the standard cup holder housing (Item 6), perform the following steps.

step1.para: Remove three pan head screws (Item 12) attaching the cup holder housing (Item 6) to passenger side (right), upper instrument panel cover (Item 4).
Lift cup holder out of housing (Item 6) and remove pan head screw (Item 10) underneath.
Remove cup holder housing (Item 6) and remove one pan head screw (Item 10) underneath.
Remove one pan head screw (Item 12) at the right end of the passenger side (right), upper instrument panel cover (Item 4) in front of the air conditioning vent.

svcsubproc.para: If the vehicle is equipped with the optional switch housing or air conditioning vent (Item 7), perform the following steps.

step1.para: Remove three pan head screws (Item 12) attaching the optional switch housing or air conditioning vent (Item 7) to passenger side (right), upper instrument panel cover (Item 4).
Remove optional switch housing or air conditioning vent (Item 7) and remove two pan head screws (Item 10) underneath.
Remove one pan head screw (Item 12) at the right end of the passenger side (right), upper instrument panel cover (Item 4) in front of the air conditioning vent.
Remove passenger side (right), upper instrument panel cover (Item 4).
With passenger side door open, remove one pan head screw and flat washer (Item 8) in the right end of passenger side (right), lower instrument panel cover (Item 1).

Remove two pan head screws (Item 9) from the bottom front edge of the passenger side (right), lower instrument panel cover (Item 1), and one pan head screw (Item 10) at the lower left corner of the lower instrument panel cover.
Remove passenger side (right), lower instrument panel cover (Item 1).
With driver side door open, remove one pan head screw and flat washer (Item 11) in the left end of the driver side (left), lower instrument panel cover (Item 2).

Remove four pan head screws (Item 10) from around the instrument panel gauges of the driver side (left), lower instrument panel cover (Item 2), and three pan head screws (Item 10), two at the right end and one in the lower front edge of the lower instrument panel cover.
Remove driver side (left), lower instrument panel cover (Item 2).

note.para: To remove instrument panel frame, remove cover and gauges as described in above procedures. Then remove screws retaining instrument panel frame to cowl (bulkhead).

svcsubproc.title: Install

important.para: Always disconnect battery ground before servicing or installing instrument panel cover.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 13for Items in parentheses.

note.para: To install instrument panel frame, place frame in position and secure with screws to cowl (bulkhead). Then install cover and gauges as described in the following procedures.

step1.para: Position driver side (left), lower instrument panel cover (Item 2) in place first, and install the four pan head screws (Item 10) around the instrument panel gauges of the lower instrument panel cover. Next install three pan head screws (Item 10), two at the right end and one in the lower front edge of the lower instrument panel cover, then install the pan head screw and flat washer (Item 11) in the left end.

Position passenger side (right), lower instrument panel cover (Item 1) in place, and snap the clips of passenger side (right), lower instrument panel cover into the driver side (left), lower instrument panel cover (Item 2). Align the right end into the mounting hole, and install two pan head screws (Item 9) and one pan head screw (Item 10) across the bottom front edge. Remove the assembly tool and install the pan head screw and flat washer (Item 8) in the right end.
Insert the front flange of passenger side (right), upper instrument panel cover (Item 4) under the " J " channel.

svcsubproc.para: If the vehicle is equipped with the standard cup holder housing (Item 6), perform the following steps.

step1.para: Install one pan head screw (Item 10) in the right mounting screw hole under where the cup holder housing (Item 6) is being installed.

Position cup holder housing (Item 6) in place and install pan head screw (Item 10) under where the removable cup holder goes. Then install three pan head screws (Item 12) attaching cup holder housing to passenger side (right), upper instrument panel cover (Item 4).
Install one pan head screw (Item 12) at the right end of the passenger side (right), upper instrument panel cover (Item 4) in front of the air conditioning vent.

svcsubproc.para: If the vehicle is equipped with the optional switch housing or air conditioning vent (Item 7), perform the following steps.

step1.para: Install two pan head screws (Item 10) under where the optional switch housing or air conditioning vent (Item 7) is being installed.
Position optional switch housing or air conditioning vent (Item 7) in place on passenger side (right), upper instrument panel cover (Item 4) and install three pan head screws (Item 12).
Install one pan head screw (Item 12) at the right end of the passenger side (right), upper instrument panel cover (Item 4) in front of the air conditioning vent.

svcsubproc.para: Insert the front flange of driver side (left), upper instrument panel cover (Item 3) under the " J " channel and push the clips into the slots in the lower instrument panel cover (Item 2). Install the two pan head screws (Item 12), one at the right end and one in the left end of the upper instrument panel cover.
